description: Erection of a single storey rear extension and a basement extension, conversion of garage to habitable space with replacement of front garage door with window, alterations to rear garden
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (01 Rev BR, 02 Rev BR, 03 Rev BR, 04 Rev BR, 05 Rev BR, 06 Rev BR, 07 Rev BR, 08 Rev BR, 09 BR, 11 Rev BR, Unnumbered Proposed Block Plan Received 04 April 2022; Fire Safety Report, 06 Rev BR (Fire Safety) Received 12 April 2022; Construction Method Statement, 1 Marbaix Gardens Design Proposal, 2204-MGR-CD001, 2204-MGR-CD002, 2201-MGR-CD003, 2201-MGR-CD004, 2201-MGR-CD005, 2201-MGR-CD006, 2201-MGR-CD007, 2201-MGR-CD008, 2201-MGR-CD009, 06 Rev S, Received: 23 April 2022) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 5 - The basement shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until a Construction Method Statement (CMS) relating to the basement hereby approved has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority. The CMS shall be certified by a qualified professional and give details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area. The approved CMS shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.
